docs.text: synopsis : easily-angered , chainsmoking architect david encounters his homicidal first wife diedre five years after their divorce .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: diedre easily cons david's not-so-bright new wife molly into believing she's a child psychologist so that she can influence molly and david's quick-tempered son , michael .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: diedre , at the same time , murders a bunch of people .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: comments : the ex is a very bad movie .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i haven't seen a turkey of this magnitude in quite a while .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i kept vacillating , however , between giving the ex one star for its sheer awfulness and three stars for its campy humor ( ultimately , i decided to split the difference and give it two stars ) .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: as summarized briefly in the synopsis , this is yet another spurned-psycho-lover-gets-her-revenge type movie .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i'm not sure how many films have been produced since fatal attraction which use this tired storyline , but it seems like 10 , 000 , 000 , 000 .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the ex , however , though following many of the standard cliches of this thriller subgenre , differs slightly from the norm in that , at least , it doesn't take itself too seriously like so many other duds do ( malicious and stalked are two examples which come to mind ) .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: those involved in the movie realize they're in a turkey , apparently , and turn in hammy performances which compliment the ludicrous dialogue contained within the script .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the ex's storyline , as i said , incorporates many cliches predominant in films of its nature ; however , the plot is so overwrought and unbelievable that , after a while , the viewer must accept that logic does not operate in the realm of the movie .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: diedre , david's first wife , kills and kills and kills , for example , without ever having to worry about police investigations and the like ( it's not as though she's bright enough not to leave fingerprints at the scene of the crime ) .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: david and his new wife molly have an incredibly difficult time understanding why michael , their son , has emotional problems , specifically his inability to control his anger .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: though david smokes like tomorrow will never come and blows up at people every other minute in the movie , the connection between him and his son is not made .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: molly is easily swayed by diedre into believing she's a child psychologist and allows the demented woman to spend time with her son .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: time and time again , things do not add up in this movie .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: if a viewer can't accept this fact , then he will definately not like the ex .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: if , on the other hand , he can appreciate the movie for its campiness , then he'll probably like it much better .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i don't mean to necessarily suggest , however , that the ex is a memorable exercise in camp .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: even when viewed from an it's-so-bad-it's-good angle , this movie isn't all that successful .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the ex does have its moments , though , almost all of which involve yancy butler ( the psychotic diedre ) and nick mancuso ( david ) .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: these two actors turn in decidedly hammy performances which , oftentimes , elicit chuckles from the audience .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the truly awful lines written for them help this humor along .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: butler gets the larger portion of bad dialogue ; every time her character kills someone , she has a punchline that's unbelievably inane .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: when she murders a tenant of an apartment she wishes to use to spy on david , for example , diedre whacks the elderly lady with a crowbar and states " i'm so sorry , your lease is terminated . "
docs.label: negative

docs.text: or how about when diedre takes out her therapist in another ridiculous scene ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: ( diedre's therapist wishes to have her recommitted , so she decides to visit diedre , alone , in her new apartment -- never realizing , of course , that it's not her's .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: therapists typically are catatonically brain-dead in these movies ) .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: having successfully snuffed the woman out , diedre looks at the body and says : " what was it that you always said to me at the end of each session , dr . jones ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: oh , that's right .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: 'i'm sorry , but your time is up ! ' "
docs.label: negative

docs.text: this is what passes for humor in the film .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the audience doesn't necessarily laugh but groan ( the type of groan that suggests the audience can't believe they're watching this crap -- although watching it they are ) .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: nick mancuso's chainsmoking , nervous-wreck character does not have the cheesy lines that butler's character delivers , but his ridiculously overdone performance provides for some better comic relief .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: in between drags off his cigarette , for instance , in one of the movie's best scenes , david tries to explain to his lawyer what a creep his ex-wife is .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: in exaggerated exasperation , he nearly shouts " the woman is a cuckoo-bird ! "
docs.label: negative

docs.text: ( trust me , it is funny in context . )
docs.label: negative

docs.text: and so , the movie continues until its painfully obvious conclusion .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i won't reveal the ending specifically ( though anyone remotely familiar with thrillers of this type could probably guess the ending just from this film review ) , but i will say that the ex has one of the biggest fire hazards appearing recently in film .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: molly and david own a cabin that becomes engulfed by flames in approximately three seconds !
docs.label: negative

docs.text: molly , at one point in the film , not-so-brilliantly observes , after discovering diedre has moved into an apartment across from her family's to spy upon them , that " she's crazy . "
docs.label: negative

docs.text: you'd be pretty crazy too if you'd rented this turkey .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i'd avoid it unless it's on tv and you come across it .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: if you do , you may want to watch it , groan at the bad punchlines and stupid plot , and feel good that you didn't spend money renting it .
docs.label: negative
